title: What's happening to Sejuani?
body:
I have seen a lot of PBE changelogs, and a lot of them mentioned changes in Sejuani.
What is Riot's project with Sejuani? What is her idea/identity as a champion in the League?
Is Sejuani going to become a DPS tank or a Utility tank?
I'm really curious.

replies.body:
tldr:

* maxHP damage moving from Q to W
* E duration nerfed from 2.5 to 1.5 at max rank
* Some mana sustain improvements

Overall, she's getting better in the jungle and worse at ganking.  You will now rank W first for sure, and it will help with clears, and your ganks will still probably be good enough to be threatening.

I don't expect her role to change.  She remains a late game scaling tank with a devastating teamfight initiation.  She will still be pretty iffy at clearing the jungle.  Although her ganks will be less good, they'll still be very strong.
Why wouldn't have ranked W first? That's her best ability for jungling and always has been.

> Why wouldn't have ranked W first? That's her best ability for jungling and always has been.

It has been correct to max E first on Sejuani jungle since her mini-rework.  You get only 10 less damage per rank by taking E instead of W, and in exchange you get all the damage up front and a 2.5 second 70% slow instead of a 1.5 second 50% one.

W typically is maxed last on Sejuani.

That's not always correct (Hi, best Sej NA here).
If you're playing Sej as a tank, then W is the way to go.
If you're playing Sej as an off tank or burst mage, then E is the way to go.

Now with the changes, maxing W will ALWAYS be the way to go. Makes it a lot simpler!
(At least from a jungle clear perspective)

> If you're playing Sej as a tank, then W is the way to go.

Can you explain why this is?

I do tend to play Sejuani with just enough tanky to not get bursted, mostly AP, but I've never gotten anything good out of maxing W first.  The way I see it, having maxed E is just so much better for fights.

> Now with the changes, maxing W will ALWAYS be the way to go. Makes it a lot simpler!
> (At least from a jungle clear perspective)

Right.  W is now a pretty awesome button, and I'm really excited about not having to Q the monsters while clearing -- better mana sustain, more safety.

I'll chime in on both builds for live and PBE

if you want to play tank sejuani you want to max Flail first because it has synergy with your build. 

* Flail scales with bonus health (on live)
* Flail allows you to clear jungle fairly effectively while building tank
* You don't have to waste mana permafrosting ( sejuani is very mana hungry)

How you are building sejuani, mage/tank. I am assuming go do something along the lines of sorc boots/ sunfire/ haunting / abysall You should max E first because

* you can 1 combo jungle camps
* you do a TON of burst damage
* allows your trade better


The difference is the play style you need. If you are going strictly tank permafrost is a waste of mana, and if you  are going hybrid or ap permafrost ends up doing more damage and the synergy with your build is better and in my opinion is a MORE fun playstyle.

As for the changes to PBE:

Going flail can be used effectively for tanky sejuani and Ap sejuani ( jungle wise) and i'll break this down as well

**Flail on PBE**

* stronger for clear time and way more damage than on live server
* % health from Arctic assault is now on flail ( no more wasting mana using arctic assault in jungle)
* scales very well with AP **and** health ( tanky items)
* very cost effective in the jungle because all you need to do it activate W and clear.
* If you want to build hybrid you should max W

**Permafrost on PBE**

* Lower base damage which means you need to have RAW ability power for it to do damage now
* building magic penetration no longer does the same burst sejauni does on live so its not as cost effective due to nerf to base damage
* you get beat up in the jungle because you are building ap without any tanky items (this didn't happen on live because you can 1 combo the jungle camp)
* You have to expend more mana to clear minions because permafrost does less damage and the CD is lower = more activation = more mana expended to do the same job ( relatively ).


Maxing W is more effective when building sejuani as a hybrid mage/tank and as a tank. While maxing E first is solely when you build FLAT AP. Late game sejuani is overall stronger no matter what build path you take. And finally for those who are worried about the first clear, it is barely noticeable.

> * Flail scales with bonus health (on live)

The scaling doesn't improve with more points, though, right?  Doesn't seem like a great reason to rank W.

> * You don't have to waste mana permafrosting ( sejuani is very mana hungry)

This seems like a sound argument to me.  Sejuani mana sustain is pretty bad if you're trying to go heavy farm style.

> How you are building sejuani, mage/tank. I am assuming go do something along the lines of sorc boots/ sunfire/ haunting / abysall You should max E first because
> 
> * you can 1 combo jungle camps
> * you do a TON of burst damage
> * allows your trade better

Right, those are the kind of items I buy.

> Maxing W is more effective when building sejuani as a hybrid mage/tank and as a tank. While maxing E first is solely when you build FLAT AP. Late game sejuani is overall stronger no matter what build path you take. And finally for those who are worried about the first clear, it is barely noticeable.

I'm super excited for the PBE changes to come to live server.  I think she'll play much better.  W first seems better almost all the time on PBE.

The scaling of the %health on hit does scale with points. The % health on hit also scales with AP. For example the scaling goes like this 4%/6%/8%/10%/12%

W is definitely the most effective and safest way to play sejuani, but for those who build her ap E is still supreme.

Lich bane is almost always a buy for hybird/ap sejuani now.


** misunderstood your question. You max W on live because the aoe damage does more damage than permafrost while costing less mana. This is because you don't build ap or magic pen on tank sejuani.**

I Am Animation got most of it. Few other things to add:
On live, you max W on tank Sej also for the cooldown reduction. Building 40% cdr and max rank W is pretty much spammable and not a big mana drain.

On PBE, this may change since permafrost's cooldown now decreases with each level. May actually be optimal (damage per second wise) to mix which skills are maxed first. I'm going to wait until Riot moves the changes to live to do the math since things can change.

She honestly plays fine on live right now, but I will not say no to buffs!

Hey Gunday, I can't pretend I have the credibility to argue with you.  I have actually seen you a couple times in other peoples streams and I know you are a killer sej... .but I still feel there's a lot of preference in that.  I get way more enjoyment and success with my playstyle maxing E.  Why can't they just give her some note like if she has a jungle item, her w gives her some life back or something along those lines?  then her sustain is fine, and she's not stuck being played one way?  I read ricks mahers twitter comments as well, I'm still not convinced.  All the fun of sej for me is banging into them with that dash, then shattering them, and when they're all scared from your burst, following them and slowly getting that last bit of HP to drain with her party flail.   Now she's just an icy champion version of sunfire cape??

Don't you get one shot in team fights building all that AP? o_O
Seems wasted since her AP ratios aren't the greatest. Love {{item:3151}} {{item:3001}} for the magic pen, but feel like you need more {{item:3083}} {{item:3143}}  items in there to survive the initial round of enemy cool downs.
Honestly asking how you play her in team fights and if it works. Curious!

There are a lot of different situations and builds i use for Sejuani and i usually base them off what the team needs in champ select and in game. Equally you have to have a different play style for each type of build. Another point i feel i should add is my build up there is just for an end game-ish build, i build a sight stone ever game on sejuani after machete upgrade. So that helps a lot with my early game tankyness when i go ap.

So her ap ratios aren't THAT bad considering her ultimate is 80% and permafrost is 50%. These are the two main damage dealers. With the coming changes to PBE Flail is going to be another spell that ramps up with AP very well because it now scales with both on hit % health and aoe damage.

When you build full AP you do get chucked  a lot easier than anything else, but you are actually pretty resilient, but not resilient enough to take 4-5 ults. Then you play sejuani full AP you have to play a little more passive and you MUST MUST MUST use your ultimate very effectively/carefully. If you aren't getting 3-4 people in your ultimate you are probably going to do all inning, but you will also very likely get a kill and trade evenly. What actually ends up happening once you get a enough ap is you do your combos and atleast 2-3 members get 80% of their health chunked and run away. In the time they are frozen and cc'd your team has enough to come in and clean up the team fight without you dying.

Nothing ever works as planned or according to theory but ap sejuani is the type of champion that does the her combo then walks out and waits for her long cd to come off cooldown before going back in. When you build hybrid or tank you can just sit in there using your w damage and probably a sunfire to do DOT and soak up damage for your team.
Gotcha, makes sense to me! Thanks for explaining.

Aww shucks, thanks man.

**EDIT:** Forgot to answer your question. You can always max E first. Just depends on what build path you want to go. I do it all the time when I need to carry in solo queue and want to go 10-0-10 out of the jungle. It'll still be fine to do that if the PBE build goes live, but you may want 2-3 points in W first (depending on where the ratios/dmg numbers end up) to help with her early clearing (changes are designed to speed that up!). Okay, here's what I said before edits:

I don't think permafrost is nerfed though!
Notice how the cool down reduction decreases on PBE with levels now? That means if you're playing well and landing your combos, you can get multiple permafrosts off in fights! Items like {{item:3025}} will help A LOT with this.

Level 5 Sej gank would look like:
Jump in with Q (maybe {{summoner:4}}  mid Q for style points).
Auto + W during knockup to apply %HP dmg and start aoe. 
E to slow so your lane can seal the kill.

Level 18 5v5 Sej fight would look like:
Land perfect ult.
Q into squishy champ (not tankline like on live)
Auto + W tankline.
Run around making sure W aoe is applied on everyone.
E to slow.
Q to peel tankline or gap close to carry.
Auto + W whoever the focus is.
E again to slow and clean up fight.
<Rinse and Repeat>

You definitely want to be building 40% cdr to make that happen though. This is one reason why her mana pool just got buffed in the PBE notes. More spells, more mana, more problems. Items like {{item:3025}} {{item:3110}}  are fantastic for extra mana.

Anyway, that's my hypothetical two cents. Still need my PBE account to play her. Rito pls!

Why would you take a small frost over an AOE damage? The AOE can help clear way faster.  Also if you look at most guides they also take W first, so I dunno where your info comes from about it being last.

> Why would you take a small frost over an AOE damage? The AOE can help clear way faster.

After the first rank, W gives you 60 AoE damage, 20 up front and 40 over 4 seconds.

After the first rank, E gives you 50 AoE damage, all up front, and a stronger slow.

It's rare for enemy champions to stay in the AoE all 4 seconds anyway, which means E is just better for ganks and only epsilon less good for farming.

> It's rare for enemy champions to stay in the AoE all 4 seconds anyway, which means E is just better for ganks and only epsilon less good for farming.

You're forgetting the on hit burst damage from the first W Auto. Which is now going to be BUFFED with the changes.

> > It's rare for enemy champions to stay in the AoE all 4 seconds anyway, which means E is just better for ganks and only epsilon less good for farming.
> 
> You're forgetting the on hit burst damage from the first W Auto. Which is now going to be BUFFED with the changes.

I am not forgetting the on-hit damage.  Each additional W rank gives you 20 on-hit plus 40 AoE over 4 seconds.  Each additional rank of E gives you 50 AoE.  Thus, W gives barely any clear speed advantage.

I am of course aware that the changes make W the correct spell to rank up.  I am explaining why Sejuani ranks E first on live.

Well, building tanky, there comes a point where W clears faster than E (since it scales with bonus health and the cool down decreases with each point). You'll also have less mana with the tank build so W is great to conserve that versus spamming all your abilities and being at zero. So it depends how you build her. Also good to max W first if you're building a {{item:3057}} item, since you can auto + W to proc it and get bonus dmg on the big creep every few seconds at max rank.

Good points.  This thread has been pretty useful for me.  Interesing to see how other playstyles work here.  My E first opinion is based on the offtank or AP builds both preferring it.

One of the big reasons I like the offtank build on live Sejuani is that it clears so much better than the pure tank build.  When you go tank Sej, how do you work around the sucky farming?  

To be clear, the offtank build I like runs {{item:3001}} {{item:3151}} {{item:3068}} {{item:3020}} as the core stuff, basically the items that give both offensive and defensive bonuses.

Live tank build: {{item:3068}}  rush 2nd or 3rd item and focus on getting to 40% cdr very quickly. Stealing enemy blue buff or taking your own over midlaner gives you 10%, another 10% from runes and masteries, early {{item:3024}}  or {{item:3067}} rushes. 

I honestly don't have trouble farming with this build. Sure it's not as satisfying as blowing up all the small minions with your E instantly, but it takes about the same amount of time (if not faster) to clear the entire camp.

Started streaming pretty regularly if you ever want to see my tank Sej in action:
http://twitch.tv/gundaymonday
#ShamelessSelfPromo
Rare yes, but that's also why it's a "gank" you do usually tend to have a teammate near by to help with it (being a team game).

> Rare yes, but that's also why it's a "gank" you do usually tend to have a teammate near by to help with it (being a team game).

In the gank context, a longer, stronger E is much better than the 10 damage payoff.  This is the primary thing, since Sejuani doesn't really like farming much and loves to spam ganks.
"spam ganks" never seen a Sej do that. I always see them constantly farming since she's a tank, and that's what I do when playing her and it works a lot better.

> "spam ganks" never seen a Sej do that. I always see them constantly farming since she's a tank, and that's what I do when playing her and it works a lot better.

As a jungle farmer, Sejuani starts bad and gets worse as the game goes on.  Meanwhile, she has world-class ganks -- knockup gap closer, almost Thresh ult quality slow, and a long ranged AoE stun.

Much better to play Amumu if you want to farm the jungle and not gank much, as he does similar things in teamfights and has much faster clearing.
Still not sure where you get any of this from but no, she really doesn't. She's great at the start and doesn't get worse.  Must not be using her right if you think that.

> Still not sure where you get any of this from but no, she really doesn't. She's great at the start and doesn't get worse.  Must not be using her right if you think that.

This isn't an opinion thing.  It's math.  Sejuani sucks at killing jungle camps.  

For evidence on "starts bad": http://cloth5.com/exploring-new-jungle-paths/ Sejuani has Nautilus-class clear speeds, plus she's going to be on low health and burning her escape to kill monsters.  Tends to be easy pickings if she actually does a two buff route.

As for "gets worse", she gets less damage per point of skill that proper farm junglers.  Her best possible rank up gets her 60 damage on an 11 second cooldown.  Compare that to some actually fast junglers:

{{champion:56}} gets 45 up front +10 AD per auto for 5 seconds on a 10 second cooldown; this is typically about 105 marginal damage per rank.
{{champion:77}} gets 90 per rank of Phoenix or 50 + 10%AS per rank of Tiger, with about half the cooldown of Sejuani W.

That's the point of the rework they're doing, in fact.  Now that camps are tougher to kill, she's not keeping up.  They want her to be better at killing camps, and they're paying for that buff by reducing her early ganking power.
How many sej's do you really see?  Maxing her e and ganking often is way more effective.
you don't do much jungle farming on sej right now to be honest.  gotta get off those ganks.   I also max w last

I am taken away that people actually always max W first on sejauni. When you max E you and 1 combo a jungle camp and your ganks do a ton of damage. You have dueling potential with E and honestly you take more damage by maxing W in the jungle

With the changes maxing W will become a viable skill path, but E will still do more damage early on. ( assuming you are not only tanking which is pretty boring)

> Why wouldn't have ranked W first? That's her best ability for jungling and always has been.

it only technically deals more damage to camps than E, which gives her a lot of cc and better burst damage, and Q can easily end up dealing way more damage than either of them in addition to giving her better peel and mobility. sejuani in her current state just sees W as a one-and-done ability.
You didnt mention that her e's cooldown is getting reduced to 6 seconds at max rank from 11 flat. That is a pretty big buff for lategame

All 3 of her main build paths are still going to viable (although her optimal damage combos are changing now). You can play her as a true tank, offtank/bruiser, or burst mage. I'm actually really excited for the buffs after paying attention to what RicklessAbandon has been talking about. Still waiting on my PBE account to try her out!
She's always been both, just like mumu.

The changes are focused on making sejuani more viable in the jungle. They are buffing her clear time and damage potential a lot, both ap and tank, with the changes to her kit. I'll give you a TL;DR

* Arctic assault does more base damage to make up for base damage lost in permafrost
* Flail of the northern winds now does % health on hit and scales with TOTAL health from BONUS health. ( makes it do more damage when tank, and more damage when building ap)
* Permafrost CD is lowered by almost 50% at lvl 5 and the slow is now 1.5s at all stages. 
* all of her skills have the same ap ratios
* mana buffs because she has really bad mana problems without blue and in even in general.


if you want a really long read, [here](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/IYJTQ9GM-feedback-sejuani-changes). The changes are a really nice buff to her overall. If the changes go through the way they are i'd be satisfied.

Wow...kindasorta considered sej one of my mains but didn't even think to be watching the pbe for her changes. I see you guys running the numbers a lot and it makes me feel a little better about this not being an outright nerf, but iunno...
I appreciate the buff to her jungle, since the new jungle's made her feel even more out of place there than before. I'm not sure it does much of anything to help with her getting counterjungled though, which has always been one of her biggest weaknesses and a reason I rarely jungle her in rift.

But my more pressing issue is...they've essentially moved all her damage to her w, but am I the only one who feels like it's still her hardest to use skill? Before the rework it was simple enough, throw it up and keep it up for HP scaling damage. And I like that it scales off her *total* health (again? Can't remember), but ever since the rework the delay between the skill and the second cast activation or the interaction between her skill and her slow aa animation has always felt awkward, the idea of now relying on that skill completely just seems really tiresome.
The nerf to her e for ganking also seems to hurt what was one of her best/only ways to come back from the bad starts she's always been prone to. Or are these changes meant to fix her starts?

I dunno, I just know I was super excited about her new skin as of this morning and by the evening I'm wondering if I'll even enjoy playing her as a champ anymore. Hope it's not as awkward as I'm worrying about, but that w's still tripping me up months later. :/

My only problem was that her clear speed actually slowed down instead speed up in early game with the juggernaut upgrade.
It seems only the magus is the only choice to keep up against attack speed junglers who buy devourer and just destroy the jungle.
Also you can easily clean the jungle while getting both buffs too without recalling,it is very doable you just have to time her abilities right.
It was also my first try with her in the jungle and had to recall only at lvl4.

Personally I don't like how the PBE sej plays.  Not only is she forced into one role / item path, she is also forced to afk farm jungle.  It made her more consistent in the jungle but takes away the fun of playing her.  

I sincerely hope they DO NOT push these changes through.

I do prefer sejuani in lane and play her AP in lane more than jungle, but even in the jungle I just dont like these changes.


I would much prefer tacking something onto her passive along the lines of "if sejuani has a jungling item, she gets xx life regen while her w is proccing jungle camps" or something like that.  Then they leave other sej builds alone while also giving her a little more sustain in the jungle.   Everyone wins.  barely anything is changed, she's still fun and has two builds.
They're buffing her! More mana, and moving Q's %hp dmg to W while also buffing the ability. I hated it at first but then did some more math. Looks really promising!

Sejuani's a bursty AoE initiating fighter: she locks up the entire enemy team with her ultimate, charges in, deals additional AoE damage with her W and slows them with a bit of additional damage with her E, by which time her team should be cleaning up. The changes on the PBE are there mainly to improve her clear and tone down her burst a tad, not change her playstyle. She has fair a bit more DPS, but her main strength is still her burst and her crowd control.
she's still going to be a cc tank, but she'll just have a little more damage to help her clear and an incentive to level w (that's where her damage will be instead of spread all over her abilities)

You can E more frequently but it does less damage. She's going to feel more like Nunu in the sense that you run after somebody and slow them to death.

Currently her chase is sub-par, and she's more of a bursty initiator.
Sejuani is being massively nerfed, so knowing Riot they're going to declare her a hyper carry now.
